title.en: Retrieve biodiversity data from the web

description.en: This process retrieves biodiveryity data, i.e. occurrences for various species, from the sources GBIF, iNaturalist and VertNet. For more details, please ask BOKU.

species_names_list.title: Species names to download (list of species)
species_names_list.description: List of species. If you have a url to the dataset, use the option below.

species_names_url.title: Data with species names to download
species_names_url.description: URL to a table containing the occurrences from any source. This can be the outcome of the match-data process.

colname_species.title: Species column name
colname_species.description: If the data provided in the data path is a dataframe, indicate here the column name with species names.

databases.title: Database names
databases.description: List of databases to consider. Only "gbif, inat, vertnet" supported.

gbif_limit.title: Max number (GBIF)
gbif_limit.description: The maximum number of data points that are being retrieved from GBIF.

inaturalist_limit.title: Max number (iNaturalist)
inaturalist_limit.description: The maximum number of data points that are being retrieved from iNaturalist.

vertnet_limit.title: Max number (VertNet)
vertnet_limit.description: The maximum number of data points that are being retrieved from VertNet.

study_area_bbox.title: Area of Interest as a bounding box
study_area_bbox.description: A bounding box: {'bbox': [south, west, north, east]} (see https://docs.ogc.org/is/18-062r2/18-062r2.html#bounding-box-value)

study_area_shapefile.title: Area of Interest as shapefile
study_area_shapefile.description: URL to the zipped input shapefile containing the study areas inside which you would like to retrieve occurrences.

study_area_geojson_url.title: Area of Interest as GeoJSON
study_area_geojson_url.description: URL to the input GeoJSON file containing the study areas inside which you would like to retrieve occurrences.

study_area_geojson.title: Area of Interest as a GeoJSON object
study_area_geojson.description: Directly post the GeoJSON containing the study areas inside which you would like to retrieve occurrences.

percentage_correctness.title: Species name correctness in percent
percentage_correctness.description: A number indicating the percentage of species name correctness that should be allowed to be replaced. High values ensure a perfect match from the standard database.

synonym_check.title: Consider synonyms from standard databases like FishBase
synonym_check.description: YES, if synoymns species names should be returned from FishBase during data checks before data download.

biodiversity_data.title: Combined occurrences
biodiversity_data.description: A table containing the combined occurrences inside the study area.

inputs.input_data: Squalius cephalus, Salmo trutta, Thymallus thymallus, Anguilla anguilla
